name: Rolls-Royce Silver Dawn
description: The name was intended to mark the dawn of a new era for the world and Rolls-Royce's place in it. They're extremely rare: only 3 of the original 28 dropheads remain in the U.S.

name: Mercedes SL 300 Gullwing
description: Among the first sports cars of the post-war era, this was the fastest production car of its time. As the first direct fuel injection series production car, the SL 300 could travel at an eye-popping 160 miles per hour.

name: Ferrari 250 GTO
description: One of the top sports car of all time. An early model fetched $38 million at Bonhams' Quail Lodge auction at the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance 2 years ago

name: Lamborghini Miura
description: This is a sports car produced by Italian automaker Lamborghini and the first super car with a rear mid-engined two-seat layout. Total 800 cars were built in 1973 and now only 400 are believed to be in existence.

name: McLaren F1
description: Power, pace and peerless quality, the legendary F1 is a technological masterpiece. The fastest production car of its time. The finest sports car of its generation. For many, the greatest super car ever built.

name: DeTomaso Pantera
description: This is a mid-engine sports car produced by Italian automobile manufacturer De Tomaso. The Pantera was the automaker's most popular model, with over 7,000 manufactured over its twenty-year production run.

name: Jaguar E-Type
description: Once called the most beautiful car ever made by Enzo Ferrari, the 1960s Jaguar E-Type is a classic sports car mainstay. So far only 18 cars are believed to be in existence.

name: Shelby GT350
description: Also known as the Cobra, this high-performance descendant of the Ford Mustang was a darling of the late 1960s. With Ford's V8 engine, the Shelby GT350 was a legitimate racecar for the street.

name: Ford Model T
description: It is generally regarded as the first affordable automobile, which made car travel available to middle-class Americans. With 15 million sold, it was the most sold car in 1972 and still stood eighth on the top-ten list, as of 2012.

name: Dodge Viper GTS
description: This has been one of the few true American performance cars since early Nineties. With an engine that can compete with European luxury cars, the Viper has been a favorite among car enthusiasts for a few decades.
